website_summaries.verdict: Many LED bulbs designed for home control systems are expensive by design, but not these. You can control them as a set or individually — a feature not always found in WiFi-compatible bulbs.
pros: Compatible with most home control systems
Easy set-up with no hub required
Bulbs are available in warmer hues
cons: Bulbs can lose connectivity to home control apps and router
Some reports of overheating at the base
Bulbs may not always change colors as promoted

customer_reviews.title: Great Products
customer_reviews.text: I love these lights. I started this obsession around Christmas time when I received a starter kit from a family member and slowly been adding more devices a few every month. There are a few options in the settings that I wish we're there, but the smart lights, smart switches and smart plugs function perfectly as expected. Here's what the color bulbs look like on my front porch with a few different settings.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable - has to constantly be reset
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for using this bulb with Alexa without having to purchase a hub. Luckily, I only bought one to try it out, but had planned to get more. I will not be purchasing any more of them...the one I have is highly unreliable. At least once a week, it loses connection from both Alexa and the KASA app and I have to reset the whole thing, making it completely un-useable. It's gotten to the point where I simply don't use the lamp it's in. Complete waste of money - spend the extra and get a different brand that actually works remotely. This one is basically just an overpriced regular bulb, not smart at all.
customer_reviews.author: KR

customer_reviews.title: Works 90% of the time
customer_reviews.text: I have the operation of this bulb through my Echo Dot. Every once in a while, Alexa will tell me it cannot reach TP-Link when I ask it to turn the light on or off. If I go to the TP-Link App, the light is unreachable at that time as well. This is resolved by manually turning on the light which seems to reset the connection after approximately 30 seconds. A minor glitch which is why I gave it 4 stars instead of 5. All other features seem to work great.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Lelievre

customer_reviews.title: Unable to reconnect after power outage
customer_reviews.text: When I first bought the bulb sometime ago, I do recall it being relatively easy to initially set-up using Amazon Alexa. This morning we lost power for about 20 minutes and it lost all connectivity. Spent more than that time trying to get it reconnected. Finally got it linked to the Kasa app but was never to get it re-linked to Alexa. Being disabled, I’ve become very dependent on my smart home devices and the help they provide. Looking for a replacement, will probably go with an Amazon bulb. For the record, have about a dozen smart plugs, different brands, none of which were affected by the outage.
customer_reviews.author: Fog City Frank

customer_reviews.title: Bulb has developed a "whine" while off
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs for their function. We use them in bedside lamps and configure them to slowly brighten in the morning to wake us. This all works great. But after a few months, it is noticeable to both of us that when "off" the bulbs have a high pitched whining noise. It's not loud enough to keep you awake, but if you wake during the night and begin to notice it, it is quite irritating. Not enough that we've got ride of them yet. Definitely recommend if you want to use them anywhere other than next to your head at night.
customer_reviews.author: Alex and Heather Chapman

customer_reviews.title: I purchased this bulb for the Echo Dot synergy. ...
customer_reviews.text: First I gave it a not so good review as I was having trouble with it. At first the bulb would disconnect from my router preventing me from using Alex or Kasa app to turn it on. Thus, I would have to manually disconnect/reconnect it. However, a TP-Link responded to my review with a solution to update it's firmware from the Kasa app. The solution completely solved my problems. Alexa easily turns it on/off, and scheduling when the bulb turns on/off (from Kasa) works very well. For the price, I will definitely buy more smart bulbs and plugs from TP-Link.
customer_reviews.author: Ark

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: My husband really wants to make our whole house a smart house and he has slowly been adding things as time goes on. He decided to get these for our living room and connect them to Alexa. At first I thought this was a little silly but I have grown to love them. I love that Alexa can turn them on, so nice when we come home to a dark house and we can just tell her to turn on the light. They also change colors and are dim-able, which I really like. When we are watching a movie we can turn them down to 20% and it is perfect! Totally reccomend these if you are wanting a "smart home"
customer_reviews.author: Brandan Atkin

customer_reviews.title: Love the product, don't love the connection issues
customer_reviews.text: We have used these bulbs for almost a year, now. We also have tp-link switches and plug ins. The bulbs are the least dependable product in what we've used. They will often lose their wifi connection and they don't seem to care whether it's at 2pm or 2am, which means a bright light next to your bedside can turn on randomly in the middle of the night. That being said, we've greatly enjoyed the alexa interface. If tp-link can/has improved the connectivity issues, this would be a five star product.
customer_reviews.author: Marci Bunn

customer_reviews.title: It's total garbage
customer_reviews.text: These are garbage. Seriously, look for a different brand. This thing constantly loses its connection and becomes unreachable and needs to be set up again. I've never had it work properly for more than a week in the ten months that I've owned it. Today was the last straw for me. I finally got the notification for a firmware update that was supposed to increase wifi stability. So, I reset the bulb and reconnected it to my wifi only to have it fail to update the firmware and become unreachable... Again. This thing sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Williams

customer_reviews.title: Indoor use only
customer_reviews.text: The bulb works well out of the box, easy to set up. However, I only gave 3 stars because it is advertised as indoor / outdoor, and as soon as the temperature hit the mid-30s the bulb stopped working and I had to go back through the set up process. I gave it the benefit of the doubt and tried resetting a few times, but every time it got too cold the bulb disconnected from its settings. I suppose I have other uses for it inside but this was disappointing. Bottom line, this is a great bulb FOR INDOOR USE ONLY.
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: These are great! I also use their switches and outlet plugs. Their app is easy to use and intuitive. I would recommend these if your starting to automate your home. The best feature of these bulbs for me is the ability to dim the nightstand lamps and schedule them to turn on at 5% when my alarm goes off. At night I have them set to 20% which it seems has helped me go to sleep faster than turning off a light at full power. With all of their products I am able to schedule lights and music to turn on systematically so it appears someone is in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Angry Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy set up!
customer_reviews.text: I have a LOT of devices on the Kasa products and I am very delighted with how easy they are to set up and how easy they are to program. I am pretty good at technology, but we all know that we are only as good as the technology is, and they have made it easy to do. I can set schedules and control at both my main house and vacation home with ease. I have to admit that in the beginning I had some fun with a relative turning things on and off remotely. After they freaked out, I apologized, but it was funny. I highly recommend their products!
customer_reviews.author: C. E. Gregory

customer_reviews.title: Bright Bulb Internet Controlled
customer_reviews.text: I love these bulbs. They work with Alexa and other Assistants. I have the "other" assistant and they work flawlessly. I integrated them with the app IFTTT and have them to turn on and off at certain times. I love walking into a room and being able to turn on lights with just my voice. They have a long shelf life as I haven't had one to die yet and they are dimmable too. They put out plenty of light at 100 percent so you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great light - it provides light and it works with Alexia!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say- it’s medium yellowish light almost indistinguishable from a regular bulb, throwing a very comfortable slightly warm light. The wireless and setup was a breeze and has worked flawlessly for months - I also have the TP wireless wall outlet and the combination is just magical - add the fire tv stick and I’ve got a total Star Trek future feeling going on here. Light is a great value and won’t let you down. Easy to configure, compatible, they have their own app too which works concurrently with Alexia too. Totally recommend buying at least one! I’d suggest just redoing your whole room with these of various wattages/brightness as needed and go completely wireless!
customer_reviews.author: CarrotCakeClancy

customer_reviews.title: An expensive light bulb. It does nothing else.
customer_reviews.text: It did work for a little while at first -- but even then, sporadically. Now it won't work at all. The message keeps saying "unreachable." Furthermore, their "support" is by email. What sense does that make? I LOVE technology, and I love to buy the latest. However, I learned a lesson here. Sometimes the latest just doesn't work. I have just purchased a $20 light bulb that I can't return because the packaging is gone.
customer_reviews.author: Lisdoonvarna

customer_reviews.title: Setup was super easy (even without reading instructions) 3 minutes from box to Alexa.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this product yesterday and setup was super easy. The app from the TP Link (Kasa) worked well and is really easy to use. This was also the first device I set up on my Echo Dot. I ran into a few odd issues (but hey, I didn't ready any directions.... so.... that's kinda on me!). However, from box to the app functioning and then through Alexa literally took about 3 minutes. Dimming feature is nice as well as I'm using this as an ambient light in the room. Unless this bulb dies unexpectedly for some reason, I can't see anything other than the five star review, it really works that well and was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: E. Jonathan Hardy

customer_reviews.title: I'm disappointed in the quality of this smart light
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in the quality of this smart light. Installation and set up was quite simple as with most smart bulbs and smart switches, however this unit loses contact with the wireless router on a regular basis. I have to turn off power to the light and turn back on in order for it to reestablish wireless connectivity. This is the only device on the home network which loses connectivity so I cannot fault any common piece of hardware such as the router itself.
customer_reviews.author: enr

customer_reviews.title: Spend more money on another product
customer_reviews.text: Update: Down graded to 2 stars. When these work, they work great! Unfortunately, My husband and I have had to re-link these bulbs virtually every week. First it is one bulb, then the other, and sometimes both at the same time! I would return if I could find the boxes. Original post: My husband and I like the smart products. This bulb works well, but it was hard to sync and it occasionally loses connectivity. We have other smart products that are less finicky.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Is 95 % of the time unresponsive.  Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: It always becomes unresponsive. Alexa tells me "sorry, the light isn't responding". So I work with it to go through the set up again and get it working again. I've come to the conclusion that it takes less time to just go turn it on by hand so in that way, it has now just become a regular light that you turn off and on by hand. Very disappointing as this was my first time buying a smart bulb. It sort of fails at being smart though. :(
customer_reviews.author: T. L. C.

customer_reviews.title: Not fun to be awakened at 4 am and have to ...
customer_reviews.text: Sort of works but connection/Alexa integration is finicky. Every time power goes out and resets the WiFi, the bulb turns itself on. Not fun to be awakened at 4 am and have to turn it off at the switch manually (or get up and play with the settings). We have a regular Tp link plug in another room, and it behaves better, and Alexa never loses integration with that, but this bulb has all sorts of issues. I wanted to stay with tp link so everything would be managed with Kasa, but my next dimmable smart bulb is coming from elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: LWorkman

customer_reviews.title: Great easy product!!
customer_reviews.text: I have teamed this bulb up with my Amazon Echo Dot in my bedroom. I LOVE how I can just walk in the room, and say "Alexa, Turn on the light" and she does it. Or when I walk out the room, I can just say turn it off, and she does. Instead of fumbling around for the switch. My light is on a pull switch to a ceiling fan, so this is SOOO much easier. Plus, if I forget to shut my light off at anytime, I can just go on the KASA app, and shut it off no matter where I am. AWESOME Product, I will be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: A bipolar bulb
customer_reviews.text: I have other tp link products but this has been quite disappointing. It works I mean, I turn it on, off, change the % of it, all through the app or through alexa. But. More often than not, it says that the bulb is out of service or network or whatever and i have to manually turn the light switch off and on again, which defeats the purpose of having a wireless bulb... But. when it does work, it's great. I can work it through the app or through my amazon alexa echo dot.
customer_reviews.author: Prithvi R

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Installation was fairly simple. Download the Kasa app, install the bulb, connect the device to your wi-fi, then have Alexa find new devices. It has misfired a couple times as any "smart" device does, but overall has worked well. It takes some time to remember not to use the wall switch. I was a little uneasy agreeing to the "Terms and Conditions" from the manufacturer (from China) as to what they can and can't do with information collected. Hopefully this doesn't have a hidden microphone. ;-)
customer_reviews.author: Southern Contractor

customer_reviews.title: Kasa Smart Wi-Fi LED Light Bulb
customer_reviews.text: I have no problems with this product. I use 5 of these bulbs in my home using both Alexa and the Kasa timing functions. I have never had a problem that is related to the product. There are many issues that can appear to be product problems but are not. Wi-Fi issues can cause problem that appear to product problem. TP-Link makes very good products. They do not require a HUB. I have used remote control lighting and appliance control for over thirty years. Yes, they have existed longer than that. No HUB is an advantage. I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: joe d0ne

customer_reviews.title: Great starter bulb
customer_reviews.text: These are great - if you're looking for a first foray into smart lighting these should satisfy your needs. I've seen some critical reviews and I'm sure there are better and more versatile products on the market but they're also the ones with the high price points. If you are just looking for a good, functional, Alexa controlled lightbulb, these are your guys. The light isn't extremely bright for an LED but I'm also not relying on it for those purposes. It's easy to setup but just note that you need to install the bulb using both the TP Link app AND the Kasa app to use it through Alexa.
customer_reviews.author: PackyTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Super convenient and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Connected with my google home very easily so I can just tell google home to turn off/on my lights or adjust the brightness. We only have them for our master bedroom but plan to have them throughout the whole house eventually. Love the convenience of it especially when I have my newborn in my hands. Easily connects to phone as well and the KASA app is user friendly even my mom figured out how to use it and she is not technologically savvy at all.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Especially with IFTTT
customer_reviews.text: Love the functionality of this. The Kasa app is really simple and is missing some advanced features, but the ability to control this through IFTTT makes it a great purchase! I have some Amazon Dash buttons set up to toggle different lights around my house with the help of amazon-dash python project that I have running on a raspberry pi. I can dim the lights, turn them on or off by using IFTTT. Pretty happy with the purchase and am looking to get a couple more for other places around my house.
customer_reviews.author: Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Better than Hue
customer_reviews.text: This product works exactly as I was hoping for. Dimmable within the TP Link Kasa app as well as with the Echo Dot. I absolutely love that it doesn’t require a hub. When I look at this versus the Hue bulbs we also have, I always prefer the TP Link ones. The Kasa app is much more user friendly than Hue’s. Edit: over 6 months later, my bulbs still work perfectly fine. They don’t problems connecting. I have consistent and strong WiFi in a small apartment, so I think that works in my favor. All in all, happy with this purchase and probably ordering more
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised for simple needs.
customer_reviews.text: I don't have multiple smart devices so can't speak from that perspective, but for a simple one device setup, it works like it's supposed to. Haven't tested the scheduling, but the dimming and on/off is all I was after. If the bulb doesn't connect, flip switch on/off and try again.
customer_reviews.author: hiroze

customer_reviews.title: Great bulbs, rock solid connection and good feature set, minor cons
customer_reviews.text: Have had these for about 2 months now, they work great. Even in rooms with a poor wifi signal, which I found surprising. Couple of minor negatives that are less obvious: - The best way to control these bulbs is with the Kasa app, no IFTTT support as yet. - The bulb is larger and longer than a regular E12 bulb, so if the space is a tight fit, these bulbs will barely fit. All in all a great purchase, but the cons above is why I'm taking off 1 star. One more thing to note - you can only connect these bulbs to your network using the Kasa app, the process is a little confusing and requires patience.
customer_reviews.author: B. Sharath

customer_reviews.title: Works great for a timed entry light
customer_reviews.text: We have the light turn on at sunset every night at 100% power, and slowly dim over the course of the night, until it turns its self off at 10pm. When you witch the light off and back on it comes on at 100% and you only have to turn it off from the app, or other controls setup (like a IFTTT control).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Has worked for 5 months so far without a glitch!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of them after getting Amazon Echo as a gift last year. The bulbs were very easy to set up and work flawlessly with the Kasa app. There was one day in February or March (do not remember) when TP-Link server crashed effectively disconnecting my bulbs from Alexa and turning off remote control but services were restored over the weekend (worked fine when on wifi). Other than this one occurrence the bulbs have been working flawlessly. I never had to reset them, restart anything. I would highly recommend them to other users. My only wish is that they came with different connector base types, as only E26 is available at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Michal Motykiewicz

customer_reviews.title: Technology lights the room!
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful product! I have a hanging lamp with no switch and it is not on a wall switch so this was a wonderful solution. I can keep the lamp plugged in and now have the light programmed to come on and go off daily. Wonderful! Extremely easy to set up although I did have to put the lamp right next to the router for the original set up as it said it could not reach the network unless it was closer (and we live in a small apartment). I love that I can use my smart speaker (Google) or my phone to control the light.
customer_reviews.author: Dede Taylor-Godwin

customer_reviews.title: Very cool
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great for turning your house into a smarter home. We have two of them in some lamps that we turn on via alexa or our phones. Has made life a lot easier. My only complaint that i wont deduct a star for is that i dont like the idea of having so many individual devices connecting to my wifi network. I wanted to get more bulbs but each bulb will count as another device. Next time I will probably go with something that has a hub.
customer_reviews.author: Mukaking

customer_reviews.title: Works, reliable.  What more would you want?
customer_reviews.text: Has been working now for several weeks in my porch light. Unlike some complaints about this bulb, i find that it it stays connected to my wi-fi router, a couple of rooms (4 or 5 walls) away, and my Echo controls it without an additional hub. Setup instructions were a little obtuse, or maybe it was just me, but once I understood them all was fine. I just wish these bulbs would come down in price and that TP-Link would come out with an outdoor Par38 flood. Most of the wiring in my house will not supportTP-Link wall switches and this bulb answers at least one of my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Joe C

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a huge fan.
customer_reviews.text: It works as a light... but the app doesn't control it. So I tried troubleshooting with their chat tech support. They were not helpful and at some point I realized that I'd spent 30 minutes chatting with someone over the internet about making your light work with my phone. You start to think "Do I need a smart light?" The answer is no. Returned.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't even get through setup.
customer_reviews.text: I could not get these to work. They turned on but I couldn't get them configured in the Kasa app, also meaning I couldn't get it to work with Alexa. I couldnt even get theough set up. It wouldnt even let me name the bulbs. Its seems like the signal from the bulbs wasnt working. Anyway, I'm returning these because $44 dollars for plain old non-connective bulbs is highway robbery.
customer_reviews.author: Veronica44h

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay synced.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this product and gave it a long try. First one was defective so sent back. Second one worked well at first but then, constantly disconnects . I put up with it despite the hassle for a long time. But the point us to make your life easier, not harder. Now, I cannot get it to sync at all. Can’t wait for Amazon Basics to come out with their own Smart Bulb line. Don’t waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Stacey BooBoo

customer_reviews.title: Great Wi-Fi Bulb!
customer_reviews.text: This bulb was relatively easy to connect to my wi-fi network and even easier to connect with Alexa! I love that I can dim the light without having to mess with buying and installing a dimmer switch. It's also pretty convenient that I can turn it on or off using Alexa while I'm at home or with the app if I'm coming home late and don't want to walk into a completely dark home. The LED is a nice warm white, very similar to the CFLs I had been using previously.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: KASA Bulb For Dimming Your Casa
customer_reviews.text: Never ever tried this type of bulb before, and since I own the TP-Link Smart Plugs, I decided to dry this bulb with the dimmer capabilities. Within three minutes it was installed, hooked to my network, and recognized by my Alexa Dot. I see more to come in my future. The KASA App works seamlessly to get these products up and running. You want difficulties and aggravation with such a simple task? Go elsewhere. Want a simple, pleasant, easy installation? Buy this product and be amazed at how well it works, and how much quality goes into the manufacturing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stack

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and works with Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: This bulb is great! I was hesitant to spend so much on a single bulb but I am glad I did. It puts off a lot of light and is dimmable and programmable. I have it set to be on when I come home, dim at night, and shut off when I leave for work. I can also tell Alexa to shut off the light when I want or to make it more dim or more bright. I've always bought smart plugs or switches before, but I am very happy with the smart bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Nave

customer_reviews.title: If you have Alexa, Wi-Fi, and Electricity...  This is a must have!
customer_reviews.text: One of the coolest and most useful products that works along with Alexa. The bulb worked flawlessly with the software and the set-up process was super easy. One of my biggest personal complaints is when I'm at home getting ready for bed. Usually I'm reading a book before I fall asleep. and I used to have to get up out of bed once I was all tired and ready for bed. Not any longer... Now I just say "Alexa, turn off the bedroom lights." Off they go and I get to sleep without ever leaving bed. Not to mention it dims on command too. It's also an LED light that last for 10-20 years. THIS THING IS GREAT.
customer_reviews.author: Jason G

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, this did not work for me. It wouldn't connect with Alexa, finally gave up after 25 minutes with tech support, and after that I couldn't get it to connect at all. Maybe it's my rural internet, sketchy at best, but I really needed the ease of turning lights on and off, because of a broken back. I had tried a TP-link smart plug before, with the same results. It makes me wary of trying any other smart helpers, no matter how much I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Karen

customer_reviews.title: Horrible help desk
customer_reviews.text: Have had an echo for six months, received a three-pack of these bulbs for Christmas. So far extremely disappointed. Set up was relatively simple, however they are being dropped off my WiFi continuously. They work less than 20% of the time. Have been trying to get their help desk assistance but that has also been frustrating. Phone went unanswered for over an hour. Chat service likewise no response for an hour. Finally emailed and got not very helpful responses. Still trying to get answers but leaning towards returning the bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Julie D.

customer_reviews.title: Neat
customer_reviews.text: This is really cool. I spent money on battery powered lamps to softly light my room, now I never use those. I can turn the light on, off or dim it with voice commands to my Google Home, Google Assistant on my phone, with the Kasa app on my phone, or automatically by a schedule. It comes in very handy to turn the light with voice controls. My lamp is best located in an odd corner of the room which is difficult to reach by hand. I realized, when I was upgrading the firmware for my light bulb, that I was living in the twenty-first century.
customer_reviews.author: scottalias

customer_reviews.title: Smart solution!
customer_reviews.text: These bulbs are great! I use these for my front-door lighting at my home. I had the option of rewiring some timers and redoing some switches to automate my front lights, but opted to just use these instead. Kasa runs great - I personally own 4 smart plugs and 4 smart light switches to automate various lights in the home. They work well with Kasa and seamlessly with Alexa. I have had these running for 2 weeks and they have never not worked. Make sure your wifi signal is good around your home before installing these.
customer_reviews.author: Albert H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great at first but glitchy after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I had been using my echo dot to control this bulb while at home and the kasa app on my phone to control it when away from home. Worked great for almost 6 months but now it's being very glitchy and I'm extremely frustrated with it. It keeps going offline and turning off "remote control" capability by itself. I noticed it was no longer allowing me to control it remotely from my phone, and in troubleshooting that problem now it can't be controlled by my echo dot either. So I guess it's just a very expensive regular light bulb.
customer_reviews.author: JRob

customer_reviews.title: Works sometimes
customer_reviews.text: I have had so much trouble with this lightbulb. About once a week or once every 2 weeks I would have to reconnect it/reconfigure because it wasn’t turning on with the app anymore. Flash forward to now, I got a new WiFi system. Re set up the lightbulb (now several attempts) and it can’t follow the schedules I set. So so frustrating. Not sure I can recommend this product. I’ll be looking for an alternative.
customer_reviews.author: Mikayla

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, very faulty
customer_reviews.text: Works ok when you first set it up and pair it with Alexa, but shortly after (the next day) it no longer shows up on the wifi network. I reset the whole thing and it showed up again, then shortly after it was gone. Seriously it's more of a head ache than it's worth. Don't waste your money on this defective product, a lot of other reviewers reported the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: HarloweThrombey

customer_reviews.title: Smart bulb for Starters
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a smart bulb without having to invest in a hub system. Saw the reviews of this and decided to try it out. Once you get through the initial setup (which took a few tries), using this is a breeze. You can use the app itself, which is easy, or you can choose to integrate it with a smart home device. I use it with our Amazon Echo Dot, which will respond to "on-off" commands as well as specified dimming levels (i.e. 3%, 25%, etc). Would definitely recommend if you want to start lighting up a smart home.
customer_reviews.author: Joanna

customer_reviews.title: The light bulbs are easy to program
customer_reviews.text: The light bulbs are easy to program. I use light bulbs in 3 different outdoor fixtures. Sometimes all 3 won't come on as scheduled. I called customer service to help with this and the agent was difficult to understand. She treated me as I was absolutely technically illiterate. Which is not the case. I just couldn't understand her because her foreign accent was too thick for meband my southern accent was too thick for her.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping

customer_reviews.title: And let there be light!  As simple as that!
customer_reviews.text: So simple to set up with Smartphone - Samsung Galaxy S7. Almost instantly. Installed as 1 bulb in a 2-bulb lamp in the bedroom. Tried accessing controls from outside the house and worked perfect. Have not hooked up to Alexa yet but love this for phone access. Will be great when away from the house at night. Bought this as a 'trial" - (available on Subscribe and Save) - and will definitely be acquiring more. Update... Just ordered the 3-pack; slightly less $ than subscribe and save!
customer_reviews.author: Hooked on Amazon!

customer_reviews.title: Works with Amazon Echo, no hub required.
customer_reviews.text: This is great for someone who doesn’t want to make a major investment. No hub needed which is nice. 2.4GHz only for anyone who cares, considering 2.4 penetrates walls and obstacles better, this is fine by me. Takes a little while to set up, but this is just the nature of the product and was no harder than other WiFi enabled devices. The app on iOS is good, haven’t tried Android. You can have the light turn on at any desired brightness, (and off) at multiple scheduled times. Works well with Amazon Echo which is much more convenient than using the app.
customer_reviews.author: Jachin Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Basically disappointed in this product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bulb a few months ago and set it up and it worked a while and then lost wifi. Had to go through the reset process and it was up and running again for a few days and then dropped the wifi. Did this several times and decided to just use as a light bulb only and reset to use remotely when we leave town and hope it works then. Basically disappointed in this product. Expensive bulb if the remote doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: GingerB

customer_reviews.title: Love the bulb.  Technology is great.
customer_reviews.text: Great bulb. Was very easy to set up and works perfectly with my Echo Dot. The TP-Link software works nicely, too. As for the light, it's nice, soft, and warm, similar to my beloved incandescent lightbulbs but with the energy saving of an LCD. Wish it was a bit brighter but it's fine for my purposes. I bought a second one a couple of weeks later for another lamp in my living room. Eventually, I will buy a couple more for my kitchen and bedroom, and most of my house will be hooked up! Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I have a total of 6 of these bulbs in my home at the moment, along with other tp-link products. I have never had a problem with any of these products. When linked to Amazon's alexa device (which I have 3 of) it makes for never having to touch a light switch. Each bulb comes with a limited warranty in case something were to be wrong with the bulb. The app is suiper easy to use and offers remote access to all the lights from wherever, whenever. You really can't go wrong with these!
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey L

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. I ended up buying 2 of them. I use 1 on my outdoor front deck and one in my family room. The app is nice I set the lights to come on m-f at 5:30am so when I get up for work the lights are on, and the front desk light is on when I am walking out to my car. I also bought an outlet that I used to turn on and off our Christmas tree lights.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Awesome. What can I say? Wish it would allow Alexa to dim by voice command. Alexa can turn on and off but that's all. Have to go to your phone to dim or brighten. I grouped the ones in the living room as "Living Room Lights" so I can turn on/off all the lights in the group. Before coming downstairs from my bedroom I can tell Alexa to turn on the group or one of the group. When I arrive the lights are the way I want them. If I forgot to turn the lights out before I went to bed I can as Alexa to do so without going back down stairs.
customer_reviews.author: Nor R. Brunschwyler

customer_reviews.title: Nice bulbs
customer_reviews.text: This is my first experience with Wi-Fi bulbs and I'm pretty stoked! I will continue buying them after this. Only thing I wish they would add is the ability to control the bulbs from a different network.. Wish I could turn my lights on from work or when I'm on vacation or something. There probably are some already out there like that tho...like I said these are my first ...Nice bulbs!
customer_reviews.author: Dom J

customer_reviews.title: I love this thing!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this thing!! I was originally using the Kasa app but decided to link it to my Amazon Alexa so now I just tell her to turn my light on:) The price is a little more than I’d want to pay but I am happy with it. I plan to try the outlets as this bulb has a lifespan (~600) and those won’t event run out. Please make sure you check out my other Amazon product reviews. I DO NOT receive a discount & im a real human being paying full price for my products!
customer_reviews.author: SweetCherryFly

customer_reviews.title: Great when it remembers it's Echo Dot ("Alexa") connection
customer_reviews.text: Great when it remembers it's Echo Dot ("Alexa") connection. While the individual app always seems to work, the Echo Dot connection sometimes gets 'lost' and has to be reset. And setting up the "skill" for this in the Echo smart phone app is somewhat confusing, although I have it down pat now after multiple trips through the menus to do the resetting. Still a pretty good tool for what I wanted it for - turning on a bedroom light without having to navigate through a dark bedroom. I can now call to Alexa from the bedroom door and turn it on, or tell the family room Alexa "Turn on the bedroom light". Slick!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Consider other options Not relyable
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to assist my mom. The light switch for one of her rooms is not by the door. One has to navigate halfway into the room to find the light switch. Which, in the dark, can pose a tripping/falling situation. We installed the light bulb and it worked.....for 3 days. After which it is a constant pain as it goes off line. So I have to go over and reset it. While I don't mind the extra time with mom, it has not been the convenience and help we were searching for. Definitely not work $20. Will be removing and going with a lamp and plug from another RELIABLE source.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Fortier

customer_reviews.title: Total waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought 3 bulbs. They worked fine for about 6 months then all 3 completely fizzled. They won't stay connected to the network and have to be reconfigured about once a week. One bulb completely refuses to connect. I tried working with their customer support, but they keep sending me links to reconfigure that don't work. I've even tried to delete the bulb on the app and reset to factory specs with no luck. One bulb is the color changing bulb which costs about $50, so that with the other two at $30 each means I wasted $110.
customer_reviews.author: Karebow

customer_reviews.title: A few hoops. Only works on 'mobile device' platform, but after that, does exactly what I wanted ;)
customer_reviews.text: Working, but there are a few 'steps' to go through. Need to download the Kasa app and set up the bulb. No smart phone, no use (the app isn't available on a computer, only a mobile platform (e.g. smartphone, NOT laptop) If you want Alexa control, you need to enable the TP-Link 'skill' From there it's pretty straightforward, but I had hoped to be able to set things up with a computer....right now, it's only for 'mobile devices'... Once you're through those 'hoops' though, it's pretty rock solid and works great from the mobile app or Alexa....
customer_reviews.author: David H

customer_reviews.title: Porch Lights
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to use for my front porch lights. Honestly, I don't know if they are rated for use outdoors but I rolled the dice and haven't had any issues and have been using them for several months. I have them set to automatically turn on at sunset and then turn off at sunrise. The only issue I have had (maybe once or twice) is that I have had to re-pair them to my network for unknown reasons. Very impressed so far!!!
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly. I have my lamp timed to turn on before I wake up, so I don't have to get up in the dark. Then to turn off after I leave for work. I also have it timed to turn back on right before I get home and off again after i go to bed. I like how you can set up several different times on the one light. The app that controls the light bulb is easy to use. The light of this bulb is a nice soft glow, very warm and cozy. I wish all my lamps looked this nice.
customer_reviews.author: M Johnson

customer_reviews.title: No fumbling around for the pull-string any longer!
customer_reviews.text: This product works with my Alexa system. The WiFi has only disconnected once in the two-week period I’ve had it installed when my other smart home connections remained. I have this bulb in a closet where I previously only had control with a pull-string. Now I can schedule it and set how bright I want it to me through Alexa routines. I’m very happy, but know nothing about motion control.
customer_reviews.author: meR (Great Falls)

customer_reviews.title: great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My biggest thing I enjoy with this bulb is that you can dim it! I have mine hooked up to connect with Alexa, and it works flawlessly! There are easy to follow instructions that the lightbulb comes with. For the price, you can't beat it. My one complaint is that it does say it shouldn't be used with a lampshade that uses metal to connect to the bulb. Not sure why, or if that's general for bulbs. Other than that, I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Cortney

customer_reviews.title: TP-Link LB110 & LB120 bulbs now working since a new router was installed
customer_reviews.text: Beware.. Bulbs can have issues keeping connected to the WIFI and working properly with older cable/modem routers. After a couple of weeks working with the TP-link customer support (not very good) and making all kinds of changes to my router per support instructions, nothing was helping. So, I broke down and purchased a newer cable/modem (NightHawk Netgrear C6900). Once installed and bulbs were re-connected to the newer router, everything works. Alexa works very good with the bulbs. My older router was installed by my ISP Time Warner Cable, Technicolor Model TC8717T Hardware ver. 1.1. Hope this saves some you some misery when trying to get the bulbs to stay on the WIFI.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and use; works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 5th Kasa purshase and each one works perfectly. This bulb doesn’t require any hub so it’s easy to use. I’ve got it set on a schedule so when the sun goes down, it comes on. I even have it set to come on when I need to wake up my toddler son and have it set to come on a low brightness so as not to startle him, but rather wake him up slowly. I haven’t had any connectivity issues and it’s easy to set up!
customer_reviews.author: Wallace

customer_reviews.title: This is the only brand I recommend for Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying the Kasa smart plugs which are the only brand I recommend to use with Alexa and the most trouble free. I finally purchased this Kasa bulb and love it! It is controllable by voice command to Alexa and by smart device. I can dim it down to a nightlight strength and up to 100% when I wake up. I will buy more of these and highly recommend them. Give a thumbs up if you found my review helpful. Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up and works well with my Alexa!
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty simple to set up and I like how you can add them to your internet without a hub. I LOVE saying "Alexa - turn off ____ light" and POOF - it's off! We're living in the future now! I HAVE had to re-set up these lights a few times, but overall I LOVE tripping my friends out with these. The dimming factor is cool too - "Alexa dim ___ light to 25 percent" and POW!
customer_reviews.author: EZ-Wisdom

customer_reviews.title: Bright, long lasting, and works great with an Amazon Echo
customer_reviews.text: This light bulb is amazing! It works perfectly with my Amazon Echo. The dimming feature is really cool and useful. For example you need to get up in the middle of the night. And you don't want to wake anyone up by turning on a light. Well with the dimming feature you can have enough light to see and not wake anyone up. This light bulb is very bright not like super high beams bright. But bright and they last a long time. Mine lasted a year maybe a little over before it went out. And it was on all the time. I highly suggest you get this bulb you will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Derrick

customer_reviews.title: I like these bulbs a lot - Update: only worked first year
customer_reviews.text: Update: half of them stopped connecting after a year or so, not what I'd expect for a $17 bulb. If you are OK with 12-18 month performance would still recommend. I like these bulbs a lot, the dimmer function is great. Easy to sync with Alexa for voice control. Only issue is that you cant use the light manually or the bulb resets itself and you need to re-sync it with the app.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Little issue with alexa, but overall great product
customer_reviews.text: Its nice to be able to control the light, but alexa has a hard time finding the device in the morning. (I tell alexa to turn off light at night, then in the morning tell her to turn the light on and she cannot find the device) Powering off the light (with light switch) then turning it back on fixes it, but thats not really the point in having this type of light. That is the only negative feature I have found. Otherwise it is great to watch movies with this light at 1% and I will probably pick up the multi-colored one in the future.
customer_reviews.author: HeXeH

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work after all!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item so I could see if I could coordinate my lamp with my other items of assistive technology. When I hooked up this item and started testing, it was creating a completely different atmosphere than indicated and we had a hard time getting it to match up with other system parts. I just gave it to my father to use with his system since I was struggling and getting frustrated with mine.
customer_reviews.author: M W

customer_reviews.title: and everything worked great. Well one day Alexa wasn't feeling well (update ...
customer_reviews.text: I really dig this bulb. We originally had it hooked up to Alexa, and everything worked great. Well one day Alexa wasn't feeling well (update maybe?) and we haven't been able to get it work with her since (it is linked in the app, etc. but Alexa does not recognize anything). I set it up for our Google Home and it seems to be working fine so far.
customer_reviews.author: J. Farris

customer_reviews.title: Lotsa fun!
customer_reviews.text: It took me while to find setting for RemoteControl so that it would work via Alexa but the app connected to bulb via iPad and iPhone immediately. That's was convenient and fun to do. When Alexa finally worked, it gave me 3 ways to control the light. By light switch, by iPad, and by Alexa. I only give it four stars for the lack of details in the app to guide the operator to find remote settings.
customer_reviews.author: Blaiwesk

customer_reviews.title: Beware if using in a globe
customer_reviews.text: This works great and the brightness can be easily controlled using Alexa. It's a bit too long to fit in my ceiling fan light globe. Instead, I put it in my bed stand light. I'm sure that the size will get smaller in the next few iterations. The only downside is that it doesn't work with Smart Life...Kaza has to be downloaded to synch up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very handy
customer_reviews.text: Works well and is easy to setup. Especially nice in that it does not require any other devices to work. The only minor issue is that for unknown reason, it will occasionally lose connection and will not respond. It is simple to fix but turning it off and then back on again. In the about 6 months that I have had it, this only occurred a couple of times so not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Ross

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Was very easy to setup. Had it connected and working with my Google Home within about 5 minutes. Was pleasantly surprised by how much we use the voice command feature through Google. Not having to fumble around in the dark for a light switch has been great and the dimming feature is definitely appreciated as we use them in our bedroom lamps. The lights put off a warm glow so they are not harsh when first waking up.
customer_reviews.author: E. Wick

customer_reviews.title: Sucks - Keeps losing connection
customer_reviews.text: Does not stay connected to the wifi - since I have gotten yesterday, I have already had to reset 7 times because it loses connection and Alexa cannot find - once I get it reconnected, Alexa will be able to control and than it loses connection ... I did the firmware on it from the kasa app but that didn't seem to help - will be returning these two bulbs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: So they were useless. This is not just a individual's error
customer_reviews.text: Unable to schedule time on or off. Trouble shooting included installing & uninstalling the app multiple times with only once getting to a screen where I could select time. Then it was only when the light would come on, not both on and off. Neither the app's help or the online help had the same sequence of screens that I encountered. So they were useless. This is not just a individual's error. I have had multiple people try to install and link the light and none could get it to work either. This light is useless to me unless I want to manually turn it on and off with my cell phone. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Wilfield

customer_reviews.title: can't control remotelly
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to be able to control remotely the lights in an Airbnb home. It doesn't quite work that way. When I'm at work and the tenants manually turn the lights on and off the light bulbs show inaccessible on my phone. When I go there it takes a while to connect to them. It's with ups and down. A bulb outside used to work, now I can't connect at all with it. They don't work in below freezing weather. if you want to really be able to control lights remotely these bulbs are not it. Inside my own house they are good. i tell Alexa to turn them on and off and they work.
customer_reviews.author: adrienne12

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hook up and work as easily as i wanted...but, great customer service response and working now :)
customer_reviews.text: Had some trouble getting it hooked up to Wi-Fi and eventually contacted customer service. They responded super-fast, however I was a bit slow in trying their 'how-to fix' remedy. When I tried to set it up again a few days later, it miraculously worked. I didn't have to go through the steps they told me to. No clue as to why it worked with original set-up instructions this time as opposed to when I first got it, but...whatever. It's working now. So far, so good....
customer_reviews.author: Kimberlee67

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I paired it with Alexa easily enough (it took me a few tries). It works well. Hopefully it will last the 25,000 hours it claims. The software that you download is fairly straight forward to use and offers more options than most of us will use. Now my bedroom light goes on and off without me fumbling for the cord button that kept drooping behind the night stand. I love IoT gadgets!
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Love these bulbs
customer_reviews.text: I started to create a smart home and this was part of the base technology that I installed first. Each board must be individually set up in the app Kasa. I am using echo dots throughout my home to control my smart home. Alexa connects nicely to the Kasa app. I was able to group not only the lightbulbs but smart plugs as well to control various appliances so that I could turn them all off with a single command. These lights are dimmable and it works very well through Alexa
customer_reviews.author: Marc Nakagawa

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than an electrician!
customer_reviews.text: These are great and work flawlessly with Alexa and their own app Kasa. I did not want the hassle of adding a hub but with TP Link you do not have to if you have one of the Alexa enabled products. I like that they are dimmable and that they can be put in any light socket. It is nice to have dimmable bulbs without having to change electrical components. Will continue to purchase these into the future as needed.
customer_reviews.author: LadyGar

customer_reviews.title: Work's Great!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the TP-Link Smart Plug and LED Light Bulb. I first tried a different plug, because it was cheaper. I spent hours trying to get it connected. I received the TP-Link Smart Plug and LED Light Bulb and first connected the plug. I had an issue the first time, but easily got it connected the next time. I then installed the light bulb very easily also. They both work from my phone and with Alexa. I haven't gotten to try them when I am away yet, but will update if I have any issues. For now, I am extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: S. Dudley

customer_reviews.title: Amazing addition to a smart-house at a fraction of the cost of the competition.
customer_reviews.text: Product connects well with my Alexa though it does disconnect a little too often. I believe that is due to my internet but that has caused some frustration. The app to link it is initially a little difficult to maneuver but you get used to it. It was easy setting up the 3 bulbs I bought and connecting to Alexa. This bulb only has 1 light and is slightly on the yellow side but if comparative to the often $50 alternatives I'll live with the slight coloring.
customer_reviews.author: Sup3rt4891

customer_reviews.title: Great for Old houses that can't use smart switches
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for my son to go along with his Amazon Alexa. We live in an old house with old wiring, we can't use smart switches due to the way wiring was run in 1920. personally...I think it's easier to flick a Light switch...but my son LOVES how his personal assistant turns his light off and on. If he had it his way, all out lights would work like this!
customer_reviews.author: llebles

customer_reviews.title: "Alexa, Turn on lamp"
customer_reviews.text: Probably the best lazy purchase I've ever made. I love the timed feature because it works as a great alarm. The set up was super easy and haven't had any issues with it. The bulb doesnt get hot which kind of weird me out but it's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: Chrys

customer_reviews.title: Bad product! I don't even use it any more
customer_reviews.text: Bad product! I don't even use it any more. Half the time, when I would ask Alexa to dim it or turn it off, "TP-Link is unavailable" would be all I get. I'd then go into the Kasa app, and it'd be grayed out. I'd end up having to manually turn off the Lamp. I have many different products in my Home Automation ecosystem, including WeMo, Alexa, Wink, Nest, Kwikset, GoControl, etc... they all work together nicely... except for this TP-Link bulb.
customer_reviews.author: Dapper Dan

customer_reviews.title: They work really for us
customer_reviews.text: We now have four bulbs through the house and the are working well. None of them are primary lights. Two are lamps and two are overhead lights on our bed. All of them are more than bright enough to read by. After the first time, the lights are easy to install, I like that there's isn't a hub. We have been using the first lights for over a month with no real issues with them dropping off. Make sure each name is different enough that Alexa doesn't get confused. We are total converts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love those wifi bulbs
customer_reviews.text: This is my first wifi bulb from tp-link. I have 7 others from another company. They all work alike. This one works with the Kasa app which I had a bit of a problem to get my account going. I had to log out then log back in also log out of my internet and log back in....whatever process actually resolve the problem all I know the bulb works as it should now. It also responds very well and fast to the echo dot...(you have to enable the Kasa skill)
customer_reviews.author: GiseleS

customer_reviews.title: ... terrible warranty policy
customer_reviews.text: The light works as advertised but one thing could be better is the app. By default, the remote control is off ????? This is the whole point of this thing right? It really takes me a while to figure it out. Update: Require users to paid for the shipment even the product become nonfunctional under warranty. The process took four weeks!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dependable - Stays Connected to WiFi
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my bedside lamp because the smart plug I had been using was constantly losing its WiFi connection. I noticed that my smart bulbs rarely lost their WiFi connection, so I opted for this instead. It's not quite as bright as the bulb I had, but it's bright enough for a bedside lamp and hasn't lost the WiFi connection yet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. This is the 2nd TP-Link bulb I have purchased. I don't have Alexa or any other type of hub it's just connected to my wifi network at home. I just use the TP-Link app and that's it. I do have an Eeros whole home router so I don’t have any WiFi dead spots in my home. This bulb is on a schedule in my Living Room, love Tp-Link products they have always been reliable for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pray You Don't Need Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: After waiting on the phone for about 1/2 hour agent literally asked me the same question 5 times, and my answer ws always the same. On the 6th time I hung up and am still waiting on the chat feature from TP-Link for at least 15 minutes. The damn bulb no longer turns on (with or without connection). Buy Phillips, at least they work.
customer_reviews.author: Whatever

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I love how you can schedule the ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I love how you can schedule the lights to turn on and off. You can even control them remotely. They even work with Alexa which is a huge plus for those times you need the lights and just want to control them with your voice. I have two reasons I did not give them a five. I can see how the set up may be challenging for tech challenged people. The other reason is because I wish the product was more developed. By that I mean integration with Tasker or AutoMagic
customer_reviews.author: Montsho11

product_meta.title: Kasa Smart LB100 Dimmable LED WiFi 800LB TUNABLE, SMART BULB, 50W Equivalent, Soft Warm White
product_meta.description: Control your lighting from anywhere with the LB100. The smart bulb installs as easily as a standard light bulb, and connects to your home Wi Fi in no time through the free Kasa app. Kasa also lets you manage your lights with your smartphone or tablet, including adjusting brightness and setting schedules and scenes. For added convenience, you can use your voice to control the LB100 when paired with Amazon Alexa. Protocols Supported: IEEE 802.11b/g/n; System Requirement: Android 4.1 or higher iOS 9.0 or higher; Wireless Type: 2.4GHz 1T1R
feature_bullets: NOTE: Requires a secured 2.4 GigaHertz Wi Fi network connection
CONTROL FROM ANYWHERE Turn electronics on or off from anywhere with your smartphone using the Kasa app (Compatible w/ Android & iOS)
VOICE CONTROL Works with Amazon Alexa, Google Assistant and Microsoft Cortana supported devices for a hands free experience
DIMMABLE Dim brightness to customize Lighting and suit your mood. The LB100 has 600 lumens brightness and dimmable white light
KASA SCENES & SCHEDULES Schedule the Smart Bulb to automatically turn on and off when away

specifications.Included Components: Smart Wi-Fi LED Bulb LB100, Quick Installation Guide
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars2,342 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
